meanings.definition: The quality or state of being able to be surgically removed or excised.
meanings.sent1: The doctor assessed the resectability of the tumor before scheduling the surgery.
meanings.sent2: The resectability of the growth determined the treatment options available.
meanings.sent3: The resectability of the cake was questionable after the kids got to it.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like the resectability of a stubborn stain, impossible to get rid of.
meanings.sent5: The resectability of the puzzle piece made it easy to fit into place.

meanings.definition: The extent to which a tumor or lesion can be removed through surgery.
meanings.sent1: The surgeon discussed the resectability of the tumor with the patient's family.
meanings.sent2: The resectability of the mass was a crucial factor in the treatment plan.
meanings.sent3: The resectability of the jello mold was surprisingly impressive.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to his work was like the resectability of a skilled craftsman.
meanings.sent5: The resectability of the problem made it easier to tackle.
